p: Additionally, NS1 can be regulated by posttranslational modifications such as phosphorylation, SUMOylation, or ISGylation ( 9). We found that residue K70 is present in human NS1 proteins and that it can be SUMOylated ( 65), in contrast to avian NS1 proteins, which present E in the same position. Interestingly, alterations in NS1 SUMOylation have been shown to affect the ability of NS1 to inhibit the IFN response ( 65); therefore, this amino acid difference could also contribute to the phenotype observed in DCs upon infection with aNS1- and hNS1-bearing viruses.
